page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object to formatted string function
page.description: Copy the ResultSet to a string.

prototypes.prototype: dim result as C = toFormattedString([RowFormattingOptions as SQL::RowFormattingOptions [, RowsToCopy as N [, StartRow as N [, ReferenceColumns as SQL::TableInfo [, UserContext as P]]]]])

description.p: Defines how the data should be formatted in the string. See [SQL::RowFormattingOptions] for more information.

argument.name: RowsToCopy
argument.description: Default = -1 (all). The number of rows to copy.

argument.name: StartRow
argument.description: Default = 1 (first). The first row to copy.

argument.name: ReferenceColumns
argument.description: When data is formatted for a column in the result set: (1) if ReferenceColumns has a column with a matching name, that object will be used to format the data; (2) otherwise the ColumnInfo property of the result set is used to format the data.

argument.name: UserContext
argument.description: The user context is passed into the evaluation of the expression when data is formatted.

description.p: Returns the results as a formatted string.
